intro: Maltebrunia maroana, commonly known as the Maltese rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the island of Malta. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found growing on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
